title: Panther - Private Layer 2 Protocol
description: To create an interchain DEX that bridges Cardano to DeFi with interoperability, institutional support, and KYC / AML compliant privacy.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal needs more detail on what they are actually going to deliver. They are asking for $120,000 without a clear proposal. Please explain what you intend to deliver and how this will benefit customers.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers claim significant experience, however no evidence is provided. Given the magnitude of the funding requested, it would be good to have some evidence of this experience, perhaps linked-in profiles? The proposal is very breif. More detail should be provided on exactly what will be delivered. What is the Panther MvP they will be integrating into. Which chains will be linked to Cardano? The first 4 months is set as define scope. Perhaps a much small project should be proposed to do this, and once it is defined come back in another round for the remained of the funding to deliver it. Without a defined scope it is hard to state this is highly likely to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Significantly more detail is required to audit thee progress of this proposal . In addition to the 1st stage being to define the project, the 3rd stage which is deliver of the privacy solution has little definition of what would be delivered and has not end date. Also what does success look like? This should be defined with goals (perhaps number of users, vlaue transacted) etc so that it can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: The team are clearly addressing the challenge on how to scale up DEFI on Cardano by proposing to build an interchain dex. Interoperability is one of the key limitation to bringing in new users.
f6_assessments.q1: It is highly likely the team will be able to implement this proposal. The team is highly qualified and it is an integration with an existing protocol so a large chunk of the work is already done
f6_assessments.q2: The team has put forward a timeline for the completion of phases 1 and 2 but not phase 3 and because phase 2 is 7 months already this is a longer term project. The required funds asked for  120,000 is significant and has not been given any clear budgeting breakdown. I think it would be good to see this addressed in more detail before funding. Overall a very promising proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement does not describe a problem but the purpose of the proposal. What problem is the proposal seeking to solve? It's up to the team to make this explicit so the intention is clear and not subject to interpretation.

The idea of ​​a DEX is within the scope of the challenge but there is not enough information about the DEX allowing to assess the impact of the proposal. The roadmap indicates Panther's MVP integration with Cardano in month 7, outside the 6-month period established in the challenge brief, so there are no indications of impact in practice.
No metrics or KPIs were included, so there is no way to measure impact from that point of view.

I recommend that the team provide more details about the proposal, like: what will the DEX interchain be? is a model similar to Thorchain? It is also important that the team pay attention to the items established in the challenge brief, as the established metrics require an indication of impact within 6 months.
f6_assessments.q1:
Despite the aforementioned information about the team's experience, there are no sources to attest to the team's qualification. There is no information about the team's experience developing in Plutus/EUTXO. I recommend adding links to more team information.

There is no budget breakdown. Considering that the proposal is requesting about 50% of the budget, it is essential that there is sufficient information to judge the feasibility of the budget.

There is no reasonable and understandable plan. No security risks were mentioned when using the bridge. Protocols that involve interoperability need well thought-out mechanisms to ensure that the synthetic asset peg will be maintained. There is no information about this.

I recommend the inclusion of missing details and consultaion of the Catalyst documentation as the basis for a new proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
A problem has not been defined in the problem statement, so it is not possible to establish the problem-solution relationship. Interchain DEX was mentioned in the proposal, but there are no details to indicate what this DEX would be and considering that DEX is the only part of the concept related to the challenge, it is essential to add more details.

There are not enough metrics, KPIs, budget breakdowns or details about the team. I recommend including these items.

The roadmap has little information indicating progress and alignment with the challenge.

solution: Integrate a privacy protocol that provides an interchain DEX & bridges Cardano to the DeFi; enabling access to retail & institutional users.
experience: Designed/reviewed 6 L1 protocols & 12 dApps, 29+ years b/w co-founders, team worked on 40+ protocols, banking, BlackRock & ConsenSys alumni.
